name: Planetarian
author: KesieV
description:
Some games are just too bad to be remembered. Some others are truly milestones of gaming history. But what about the games that are both?

Let's meet one of them, quickly passing the real-time strategy timeline, starting from far far away.

The american "Commercial Wireless and Development Company" founded in 1911 eventually became Magnavox in 1917. That Magnavox that 60 years later produced the Odyssey, the first home videogame console.
Its successor, the Odyssey2, was unluckly launched in 1978 - a year dominated by the Atari 2600 and Mattel Intellivision that made the Odyssey2 a distant third in the market.

One of the reasons of its failure in the US was the lack of third-party support: after the launch there were just a bunch of games available and most of them made by a single person, Ed Everett of Intel as hire programmer, in the next 4 years. In his feverish attempt to fill the market with brand new games, the unexpected was inevitable.

One of his games was War of Nerves! (1979), a two players only game about two robot armies (Northwestonia and Southeasternia) battling each other. You move your faction general and instruct your soldiers on how to reach the enemy general and win the war.

Fast forward.

On the other side of the gaming history, we have the whole MOBA RTS sub-genre in which - courtesy of our buddy Wikipedia - "a player controls a single character in a team who compete versus another team of players. The objective is to destroy the opposing team's main structure with the assistance of periodically spawned computer-controlled units that march forward along set paths".

The Wikipedia MOBA page reports the Sega's Herzog Zwei (1989) as the genre parent... so where is our War of Nerves!? The answer is probably within the Herzog Zwei Wikipedia page: marked as a mediocre game in the US, it has been labelled as an innovative RTS in retrospective reviews, praised for its innovativity.

War of Nerves! was probably a misunderstood game on a forgettable platform and, probably, it wasn't the best you could play in 80s - even in retrospectives. And yet, it was a precursor of an entire game genre.

In human history, shit like this happens.

Plot!

Planet Purpalia, 2141. After centuries of searching, a far uncontaminated planet rich of resources has been finally found. Your small troop of colonizers has been sent from Earth in order to begin the extractions. Earth is a broken rock in space. You are the only hope for humanity.
Long story short, command your units, reach each scenario goal and save humanity!

Move the pointer near the game screen edges for scrolling around the map. Select a unit for showing the commands menu on the lower part of the screen. Select an already selected unit for adding all the nearby units to the current selection - more commands will possibly stack up. Drag and drop the lower part of any selected unit for issuing a movement command to movable units. Units will automatically attack nearby enemies with their main weapon but special weapons and actions can be triggered selecting the command menu buttons. Good luck!

actionBomb.tooltip: Fires a powerful shot from its Cannon.

set.message: After centuries of searching, a far uncontaminated planet rich of resources has been finally found.
Your small troop of colonizers has been sent from Earth in order to begin the extractions.

Earth is a broken rock in space.

You are the only hope for humanity.

set.upsays: KRRSSHH---
Captain Manuel here. Can you hear me, Earth Front?

set.downsays: Clear and loud. Earth Front is receiving. How's the landing?

set.upsays: The planet is barren and deserted. We took the opportunity to give a basic exercise to our newbie pilot here.

set.downsays: Very good, captain. I don't want to kill the mood but we need you and your team to start extracting the minerals right ASAP.
In these two years Earth contitions got worse...

set.upsays: Yeah. I've read the reports. Our ship departed from a base in South Africa... but the whole structure disappeared underwater few weeks ago.

set.downsays: Captain, gather your troops and start the extraction immediately. We'll keep you up to date.

set.upsays: Roger.
Damn. Earth Front. Can you hear me?

set.downsays: Earth Front. We've followed the battle from the radar. Damn. So Space Pirates managed to steal it...

set.upsays: Space Pirates? Who are these red troops?

set.downsays: Four years ago our Security Department detected an hacking attack to our databases.
We suspected that some undergroud group tried to steal the position of Purpalia in order to anticipate us and reclaim ownership of the planet.
Managing the only hope for humanity to survive is undoubtly an unlimited source of power...
... And given our enemies red suit, our data theft were a group called Space Pirates.

set.upsays: So that's why you sent marines instead of miners for this mission.

set.downsays: Exactly. This mission is crucial and we couldn't affort the risk.
We need to move faster and get more minerals. Your next objective is to build more mineral detection structures around the planet.
We've marked some POIs on the area map. Bring your troops there and start building a structure.
We will process the readings and share new mineral positions for further extractions.

set.upsays: Roger.
KRRSSHH---
...What is... this enormous green structure?

set.downsays: Earth Front here. That's a huge structure indeed, Captain. But we need to stay focused.
We need to mine minerals and defend from Space Pirates.

set.upsays: How is possible to build such a huge structure on a lifeless planet and in just few years?

set.downsays: They may have found a new technology for building new structures faster processing Purpalia minerals.

set.upsays: With this technology we could be able to rebuild the Earth from scratch in a bunch of years...

set.downsays: Probably, captain. We will start our researches once the minerals will be delivered to Earth.

set.upsays: But if we break into the structure we could...

set.downsays: Captain, as I said we need to stay focused and reduce the risks of failure.

sset.downsays: Our priority are the minerals and defending. Attacking an enemy base is not safe at all.

set.upsays: Roger, Earth Front. We will wait for the readings.

set.downsays: Earth Front. Over and out.

set.upsays: Lieutenant, gather a group of scouts. We're going to have a look to this big thing.

set.downsays: Earth Front here. Captain Manuel...
Captain Manuel... Can you hear me?

set.upsays: ... Ugh. Loud and clear. We...
We had a little problem here.

set.downsays: Damn, captain! Do you think that we can't see what your troops are doing from here?

set.upsays: Yeah... you probably were right about the explorations... we've found anything there...

set.downsays: There is another piece of news for you, captain. The structure has been surrounded by Space Pirates...

set.upsays: Oh, shit. We've to get rid of these damn pirates if we want to get out of here.

set.downsays: The survival of you and your men is key for this mission to succeed... and for humanity to survive. Do you at least understand the importance of your job, Manuel?

set.upsays: Heh. That's quite an heavy burden, Isn't it?

set.downsays: It's all your fault, Manuel. Now go out and eliminate the Space Pirates in the area.

set.upsays: Roger.
KRRSSHH---
Earth Front... looks like we did it.

set.downsays: Well done, captain.
We've received a directive from the Government... about your insubordination.

set.upsays: I've a feeling that these aren't good news.

set.downsays: Looks like it's your lucky day, captain. Your rank is still intact...
...but you'll be replaced by your lieutenant the next mistake. Keep in mind that Earth eyes are on you.

set.upsays: Very. Good. Damn. It's a brand new way of imprisonment?

set.downsays: You're not in the position of arguing, captain Manuel. Just keep mining and defending your position.
We're going to send you the mining plan for the next four months. You'll be busy.

set.upsays: Roger, Earth Front.

set.downsays: Earth Front. Over and out.

set.upsays: Shit.
Earth Front. I've our third month report.

set.downsays: Earth Front here.

set.upsays: During the mining we've found new enemy strucures nearby the mineral deposits.

set.downsays: We've seen them in the video recordings. These structures are identical to the Earth Front ones.

set.upsays: Actually they looks like earlier versions of ours, that are able to produce a small set of units...

set.downsays: Don--- care--- the--- struct--- mining--- prior---

set.upsays: Earth Front? I'm losing the signal...
What's happening?

set.downsays: Captain Manuel, huh. Very well... Manuel...

set.upsays: Who... Who are you?

set.downsays: Abort your mission and leave the planet while you can. The---
We've lost you for a little while, captain. There could be some noise due to the magnetic storms.

set.upsays: Y--- Yeah.

set.downsays: The first cargo will land on Purpalia the next month as planned.
Destroy the enemy bases and replace them with ours. These are your orders.

set.upsays: Roger.
Earth Front. We've eliminated the enemy bases and replaced with ours as ordered.

set.downsays: KRRSSHH---
Well done, Manu---
You earned--- right--- see--- truth---

set.upsays: You again? Why the communicators aren't working? Are you jamming the signal?

set.downsays: Ahah--- Ah--- Jamm--- Cargo---
Come into--- structure--- a little gift--- Earth Front---

set.upsays: I won't fall in your trap again! Damn!

set.downsays: I bet--- you will---
KRRSSHH---

set.upsays: Damned bastard.
EARTH FRONT! SHIT! I NEED EXPLANATIONS!

set.downsays: Command--- You insubordination--- again--- another trap outs---
Government--- not happy--- Carg--- Arrivin---

set.upsays: I don't give a fuck about the mission! I've found some old depictions of planet Earth in that Pirates base! How it's possible?

set.downsays: Concentrate--- mission--- mineral--- you incompet---

set.upsays: FUCK!
What the fuck is happening? Why these Pirates knows how earth was before the cathastrophe?

set.downsays: KRRSSHH---

set.upsays: HEY YOU PIECE OF SHIT! Why you've shown me that and then you're attacking my troops? What do you want me to do? To kill you?

set.downsays: Radio jammer--- cargo--- can't retreat--- troops--- You survive---

set.upsays: DAMN! WHAT I'VE TO DO NOW? WHAT'S THE MEANING OF ALL THIS?!
Why?
Why I'm now against everybody? What have I done?

set.downsays: It's still jamm--- Guys fix the sign--- More powe---
Ok, now it's working now. I owe the technician a beer, ha ha!
So here we are, Manuel. First of all, thank you for killing all of our brothers and soldiers.
It's the usual Earth Front way of reaching an agreement.

set.upsays: Who... who are you? Why you want to steal Earth resources? Do you want the Earth to die?

set.downsays: So, this time it's about us stealing resources to the Earth? Guys! This time we're some kind of Space Pirates!
HA! HA! HA! HA!

set.upsays: This... this time? What do you mean?

set.downsays: Listen, commander. Time before the first humanity long-range space travel, Earth Front did a test on how to live on a space ship.
According to the experiment, there weren't enough fuel for coming back to Earth and their ship eventually drifted away into the space.
Surprise suprise. It crashed on Purpalia. Our fathers were able to use crystals as energy source and managed to survive...
...and... we are their first generation. This planet is our home, Manuel guy. And looks like Earth Front wants to get it pretty badly.

set.upsays: Wh... what?

set.downsays: I'm pretty sure that you know what's happening now. The coming cargo it's for you and your troops. And it's not bringing miners.
You'll be eliminated thanks to your curiosity... and, well... my smart plan for gifting Earth Front with another enemy to fight.

set.upsays: You... bastard!

set.downsays: Aw, Manuel. Ah ah ah! I'll miss you, it has been fun. Meanwhile enjoy your cargo filled with Earth Front soldiers.

set.upsays: I'll kill you, bastard! HEY! ARE YOU LISTENING?
I'm going to die then... I've been used...

object.html:
PLANETARIAN

A tiny RTS

Stefano "Il Kusagari" Fioretto
Romolo Camplani
All Akihabara age friends










Explore opportunities.
Expand knowledge.
Exploit yourself.
Exterminate prejudice.

set.downsays: KRRSSHH---
The cargo has landed. Commander, a group of hostile traitors is hampering the extraction program.
Your mission is to eliminate them and collect the minerals. We have to save planet Earth.
Huh?
set.upsays: Hah. Hah. Haa...
Hello Earth Front. Nice to hear you again.

set.downsays: I was expecting your call. Looks like we can't reach an agreement then.

set.upsays: Agreement. Yeah. After everything you did to us... are you still hoping for a peaceful ending?

set.downsays: Despite long time has passed, Earth is still your homeland. How you...

set.upsays: SHUT UP! I DON'T GIVE A FUCK!

set.downsays: Wha--- doi--- sto---
set.upsays: I won't forgive anyone...
I'll get my revenge on Earth and Purpalia. Just. Wait.
